meanings.definition: The state or quality of being anonymous.
meanings.sent1: In online forums, people often prefer the anonymities to protect their privacy.
meanings.sent2: The anonymities of the masked superhero intrigued the public.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to uncover the anonymities of the mysterious blogger.
meanings.sent4: The anonymities of the internet can sometimes lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: She valued the anonymities of her pen name, allowing her to write freely.

meanings.definition: The condition of having an unknown or unacknowledged authorship.
meanings.sent1: The anonymities of the unsigned letter puzzled the recipient.
meanings.sent2: Literary works with anonymities often spark curiosity among readers.
meanings.sent3: The anonymities of the unsigned painting added an air of mystery to the art gallery.
meanings.sent4: The anonymities of the ancient manuscript fascinated historians.
meanings.sent5: The anonymities of the unsigned contract raised suspicions among the parties involved.

meanings.definition: The practice of keeping one's identity hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: For safety reasons, she maintained the anonymities while browsing online.
meanings.sent2: The anonymities of the whistleblower were crucial to protect their identity.
meanings.sent3: The anonymities of the masked ball added an element of intrigue to the event.
meanings.sent4: In the world of espionage, maintaining anonymities is essential for agents.
meanings.sent5: The anonymities of the mysterious author kept readers guessing about their true identity.
